title: The Moonshot Factory
summary: 100+ experiments annually, 2% graduation rate, teams bonused for killing projects

content.whatItIs: Alphabet's 'moonshot factory'—a dedicated organization for pursuing radical, high-risk innovations with potential for 10x impact. Operates on deliberately different rules than the rest of Google.
howItWorks: 2% graduation rate (projects that become real businesses after 5-6 years)
Explicit incentives for killing projects: teams get bonuses, applause, hugs, high fives, and promotions for ending projects early
'Pre-mortem' analysis before projects start (predict why it will fail)
'Run at all the hardest parts of the problem first'
Surviving projects get concentrated resources: 44% of X's entire budget goes to the 2% that graduate
content.coreInsight: CEO Astro Teller: The incentive structure is the innovation. By rewarding failure and making project termination a badge of honor, X eliminates the sunk cost fallacy and political protection of zombie projects.
content.keyMetrics: Graduates: Waymo, Verily, Wing, Loon, Chronicle. Series X Capital: $500M+ fund for spinouts.

extendedContent.2026StrategicShift: X is increasingly spinning out projects as independent companies rather than keeping them within Alphabet. Series X Capital ($500M+ raised, run by former YouTube exec Gideon Yu) invests in X spinouts with Alphabet as minority investor. Recent moonshots: Anori (AI for real estate/construction), Moonshot for Circularity (plastics recycling with hyperspectral imaging), Tapestry (AI-powered electric grid visibility), Project Bellwether (wildfire/flood prediction). Reports indicate budget shrinkage and evolving from 'renegade team' to 'startup incubator' as Alphabet focuses on core AI products.
